What is Rice Brown Spot Disease?: Rice Brown Spot Disease is a fungal infection caused by the pathogen Bipolaris oryzae. It manifests as small, dark-brown lesions with a yellowish halo on rice leaves, affecting plant health and yield.

What are recommended management practice: Management practices include planting resistant varieties, applying fungicides preventively, practicing crop rotation, and maintaining proper irrigation and fertilization.
